>> Having multiple URIs for multiple representations of the same resource 
>> implies that they are separate resources. I can't see how that approach 
>> is acceptable as a RESTful design.
>
> GET /customer
> Accept: text/html
>
> 200 OK
> Content-Location: /customer.html
> Vary: Accept
>
> Generic uris are an important part of webarch, and each representation 
> being exposed as a separate resource doesn't strike me as being an issue. 
> Which part of REST is this breaking?
